SEARCH
Package bignumber

Interface BigNumber

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<BigNumber>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BigNumberImpl
public interface BigNumber extends Comparable<BigNumber>
This interface represents a BigNumber that defines the operations listed below.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    BigNumber
    add(BigNumber other)
    Given two BigNumber, it adds them and return the sum of it without changing either numbers.
    void
    addDigit(int digit)
    It takes a single digit and add it to this number.
    BigNumber
    copy()
    Return an identical and independent copy of this number.
    int
    getDigitAt(int position)
    It takes a position, and returns the digit at that position.
    int
    length()
    Return the number of digits in this number.
    void
    shiftLeft(int shiftsBy)
    Given the argument, it shifts this number to the left by that number.
    void
    shiftRight(int shiftsBy)
    Given the argument, it shifts this number to the right by that number.

    Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

    compareTo

  • Method Details

    • length

      int length()
      Return the number of digits in this number.
      Returns:
      length of this number.

    • shiftLeft

      void shiftLeft(int shiftsBy)
      Given the argument, it shifts this number to the left by that number. If a negative number of left-shifts is given, it will correspond to those many right shifts.
      Parameters:
      shiftsBy - a number to be used to shift this number by.

    • shiftRight

      void shiftRight(int shiftsBy)
      Given the argument, it shifts this number to the right by that number. If the number is 0, it can be right-shifted any positive n times, yielding the same number 0. But a negative number of right-shifts will correspond to those many left-shifts.
      Parameters:
      shiftsBy - a number to be used to shift this number by.

    • addDigit

      void addDigit(int digit) throws IllegalArgumentException
      It takes a single digit and add it to this number.
      Parameters:
      digit - a number to be added to this number.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the digit passed to it is not a single non-negative digit.

    • getDigitAt

      int getDigitAt(int position) throws IllegalArgumentException
      It takes a position, and returns the digit at that position. Positions starts at 0 (rightmost).
      Parameters:
      position - the specified index.
      Returns:
      the digit at the specified position.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid position is passed.

    • copy

      BigNumber copy()
      Return an identical and independent copy of this number.
      Returns:
      the copy of this number.

    • add

      BigNumber add(BigNumber other)
      Given two BigNumber, it adds them and return the sum of it without changing either numbers.
      Parameters:
      other - the number to be added.
      Returns:
      the sum of two numbers.
